text: Aïda Sellam (born September 13, 1977) is a Tunisian javelin thrower. Her personal best throw is 60.87 metres, achieved in June 2004 in Tunis. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1995 |African Junior Championships |Bouaké, Ivory Coast |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Javelin throw (old) |47.38 m |- |1999 |All-Africa Games |Johannesburg, South Africa |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Javelin throw |48.91 m |- |2000 |African Championships |Algiers, Algeria |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Javelin throw |53.35 m |- |rowspan=2|2001 |Jeux de la Francophonie |Ottawa, Canada |4th |Javelin throw |53.34 m |- |Mediterranean Games |Radès, Tunisia |5th |Javelin throw |53.23 m |- |rowspan=2|2002 |African Championships |Radès, Tunisia |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Javelin throw |55.46 m (CR) |- |World Cup |Madrid, Spain |8th |Javelin throw |52.48 m* |- |2003 |All-Africa Games |Abuja, Nigeria |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Javelin throw |54.58 m |- |rowspan=3|2004 |African Championships |Brazzaville, Congo |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Javelin throw |54.68 m |- |Pan Arab Games |Algiers, Algeria |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Javelin throw |58.64 m |- |Olympic Games |Athens, Greece |24th (q) |Javelin throw |57.76 m |- |2005 |Mediterranean Games |Almería, Spain |4th |Javelin throw |54.19 m |} * Representing Africa. ==References== * Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:Tunisian female javelin throwers Category:Olympic athletes of Tunisia Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:African Games gold medalists for Tunisia Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1999 All-Africa Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2003 All-Africa Games
title: Aïda Sellam
